verses.verse: After<WH310> these<WH428> things<WH1697> when the anger<WH2534> of King<WH4428> Ahasuerus<WH325> had subsided,<WH7918> he remembered<WH2142> Vashti<WH2060> and what<WH834> she had done<WH6213> and what<WH834> had been decreed<WH1504> against<WH5921> her.

"And let the king<WH4428> appoint<WH6485> overseers<WH6496> in all<WH3605> the provinces<WH4082> of his kingdom<WH4438> that they may gather<WH6908> every<WH3605> beautiful<WH2896> young<WH5291> virgin<WH1330> to Susa<WH7800> the capital,<WH1002> to the harem,<WH1004> <WH802> into the custody<WH3027> of Hegai,<WH1896> the king's eunuch,<WH5631> who was in charge<WH8104> of the women;<WH802> and let their cosmetics<WH8562> be given<WH5414> [them.]

"Then let the young<WH5291> lady<WH5291> who<WH834> pleases<WH3190> <WH5869> the king<WH4428> be queen<WH4427> in place<WH8478> of Vashti.<WH2060>" And the matter<WH1697> pleased<WH3190> <WH5869> the king,<WH4428> and he did<WH6213> accordingly.<WH3651>

[Now] there was a Jew<WH3064> in Susa<WH7800> the capital<WH1002> whose name<WH8034> was Mordecai,<WH4782> the son<WH1121> of Jair,<WH2971> the son<WH1121> of Shimei,<WH8096> the son<WH1121> of Kish,<WH7027> a Benjamite,<WH376> <WH3228>

who<WH834> had been taken<WH1540> into exile<WH1540> from Jerusalem<WH3389> with the captives<WH1473> who<WH834> had been exiled<WH1540> with Jeconiah<WH3204> king<WH4428> of Judah,<WH3063> whom<WH834> Nebuchadnezzar<WH5019> the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> had exiled.<WH1540>

And he was bringing<WH539> up Hadassah,<WH1919> that is Esther,<WH635> his uncle's daughter,<WH1323> for she had<WH369> neither<WH369> father nor<WH1> mother.<WH369> Now the young<WH517> lady<WH5291> was beautiful<WH5291> of form<WH3303> and face,<WH8389> and when her father and her mother<WH4758> died,<WH1> Mordecai<WH517> took<WH4194> her as his own daughter.<WH4782>

So it came<WH1961> about when the command<WH1697> and decree<WH1881> of the king<WH4428> were heard<WH8085> and many<WH7227> young<WH5291> ladies<WH5291> were gathered<WH6908> to Susa<WH7800> the capital<WH1002> into the custody<WH3027> of Hegai,<WH1896> that Esther<WH635> was taken<WH3947> to the king's palace<WH1004> into the custody<WH3027> of Hegai,<WH1896> who was in charge<WH8104> of the women.<WH802>

Now the young<WH5291> lady<WH5291> pleased<WH3190> <WH5869> him and found<WH5375> favor<WH2617> with him. So he quickly<WH926> provided<WH5414> her with her cosmetics<WH8562> and food,<WH4490> gave<WH5414> her seven<WH7651> choice<WH7200> maids<WH5291> from the king's palace,<WH1004> and transferred<WH8132> her and her maids<WH5291> to the best<WH2896> place in the harem.<WH1004> <WH802>
Esther<WH635> did not make<WH5046> known<WH5046> her people<WH5971> or her kindred,<WH4138> for Mordecai<WH4782> had instructed<WH6680> her that she should not make<WH5046> [them] known.<WH5046>

And every<WH3605> day<WH3117> Mordecai<WH4782> walked<WH1980> back<WH1980> and forth in front<WH6440> of the court<WH2691> of the harem<WH1004> <WH802> to learn<WH3045> how<WH7965> Esther<WH635> was and how<WH4100> she fared.<WH6213>

Now when the turn<WH8447> of each<WH5291> young<WH5291> lady<WH5291> came<WH5060> to go<WH935> in to King<WH4428> Ahasuerus,<WH325> after<WH4480> the end<WH7093> of her twelve<WH8147> <WH6240> months<WH2320> under the regulations<WH1881> for the women<WH802> – for the days<WH3117> of their beautification<WH4795> were completed<WH4390> as follows:<WH3651> six<WH8337> months<WH2320> with oil<WH8081> of myrrh<WH4753> and six<WH8337> months<WH2320> with spices<WH1314> and the cosmetics<WH8562> for women<WH802> –

the young<WH5291> lady<WH5291> would go<WH935> in to the king<WH4428> in this<WH2088> way:<WH2088> anything<WH3605> that she desired<WH559> was given<WH5414> her to take<WH935> with her from the harem<WH1004> <WH802> to the king's palace.<WH1004>

In the evening<WH6153> she would go<WH935> in and in the morning<WH1242> she would return<WH7725> to the second<WH8145> harem,<WH1004> <WH802> to the custody<WH3027> of Shaashgaz,<WH8190> the king<WH4428>'s eunuch<WH5631> who was in charge<WH8104> of the concubines.<WH6370> She would not again<WH5750> go<WH935> in to the king<WH4428> unless<WH3588> <WH518> the king delighted<WH2654> in her and she was summoned<WH7121> by name.<WH8034>

Now when the turn<WH8447> of Esther,<WH635> the daughter<WH1323> of Abihail<WH32> the uncle<WH1730> of Mordecai<WH4782> who<WH834> had taken<WH3947> her as his daughter,<WH1323> came<WH5060> to go<WH935> in to the king,<WH4428> she did not request<WH1245> anything<WH1697> except<WH3588> <WH518> what<WH834> Hegai,<WH1896> the king's eunuch<WH5631> who was in charge<WH8104> of the women,<WH802> advised.<WH559> And Esther<WH635> found<WH5375> favor<WH2580> in the eyes<WH5869> of all<WH3605> who saw<WH7200> her.

So Esther<WH635> was taken<WH3947> to King<WH4428> Ahasuerus<WH325> to his royal<WH4438> palace<WH1004> in the tenth<WH6224> month<WH2320> which<WH1931> is the month<WH2320> Tebeth,<WH2887> in the seventh<WH7651> year<WH8141> of his reign.<WH4438>

And the king<WH4428> loved<WH157> Esther<WH635> more<WH4480> than<WH4480> all<WH3605> the women,<WH802> and she found<WH5375> favor<WH2580> and kindness<WH2617> with him more<WH4480> than<WH4480> all<WH3605> the virgins,<WH1330> so that he set<WH7760> the royal<WH4438> crown<WH3804> on her head<WH7218> and made<WH4427> her queen<WH4427> instead<WH8478> of Vashti.<WH2060>

Then the king<WH4428> gave<WH6213> a great<WH1419> banquet,<WH4960> Esther's banquet,<WH4960> for all<WH3605> his princes<WH8269> and his servants;<WH5650> he also made<WH6213> a holiday<WH2010> for the provinces<WH4082> and gave<WH5414> gifts<WH4864> according to the king's bounty.<WH3027>
And when the virgins<WH1330> were gathered<WH6908> together the second<WH8145> time,<WH8145> then Mordecai<WH4782> was sitting<WH3427> at the king's gate.<WH8179>

Esther<WH635> had not yet made known<WH5046> her kindred<WH4138> or her people,<WH5971> even<WH9201> as Mordecai<WH4782> had commanded<WH6680> her, for Esther<WH635> did<WH6213> what<WH3982> Mordecai<WH4782> told<WH5046> her as she had done<WH1961> when<WH9201> under his care.<WH545>

In those<WH1992> days,<WH3117> while Mordecai<WH4782> was sitting<WH3427> at the king<WH4428>'s gate,<WH8179> Bigthan<WH904> and Teresh,<WH8657> two<WH8147> of the king's officials<WH5631> from those who guarded<WH8104> the door,<WH5592> became<WH7107> angry<WH7107> and sought<WH1245> to lay<WH7971> hands<WH3027> on King Ahasuerus.<WH325>
But the plot<WH1697> became known<WH3045> to Mordecai,<WH4782> and he told<WH5046> Queen<WH4436> Esther,<WH635> and Esther<WH635> informed<WH559> the king<WH4428> in Mordecai's name.<WH8034>

Now when the plot<WH1697> was investigated<WH1245> and found<WH4672> [to be so,] they were both<WH8147> hanged<WH8518> on a gallows;<WH6086> and it was written<WH3789> in the Book<WH5612> of the Chronicles<WH1697> <WH3117> in the king's presence.<WH6440>
